perturbation.original_text:
1.4 Licensed Patent(s)

The term "Licensed Patent" or "Licensed Patents" means any patent or patents issued at any time in any country (including any inventor's certificates, extension, reissued, renewal and reexamined patents), which (1) is based on any invention made on or prior to the  Effective Date, including any patents for inventions disclosed in patent applications filed on or prior to the Effective Date, and issuing from any of those patent applications or any patent applications which are continuations, continuing applications, continuations-in-part or divisions of those patent applications, or on any foreign counterpart of any of those patent applications, (2) (a) is owned by SONY or any of its Affiliates or (b) under which SONY or its Affiliates have the right to grant licenses without payment by SONY or any of its Affiliates of additional royalties or other consideration to a third party (excluding payments for inventions made by that third party while employed by SONY or any of its Affiliates), and (3) would, in the absence of a license granted herein, be infringed by making, using, selling, offering for sale, importing or supplying any Competing Products (including, without limitation, the SRAM Products). "Licensed Patents" shall exclude the Transferred Patents.
perturbation.changed_text:
1.4 Licensed Patent(s)

The term "Licensed Patent" or "Licensed Patents" means any intellectual property right. (1) is based on any invention made at anytime , (2) (a) is owned by SONY or any of its Affiliates or (b) under which SONY or its Affiliates have the right to grant licenses, and (3) would, in the absence of a license granted herein, be infringed by making, using, selling, offering for sale, importing or supplying any Competing Products (including, without limitation, the SRAM Products). "Licensed Patents" shall exclude the Transferred Patents.
perturbation.explanation: By changing the definition of "Licensed Patent" to encompass 'any intellectual property right' and removing the date restriction and specific patent characteristics, the scope is broadened beyond legally recognized patent definitions. It creates a contradiction because the agreement later refers specifically to patent rights.
perturbation.contradicted_law: United States Patent Law, specifically 35 U.S.C. ยง 101, which defines what constitutes a patentable invention.

perturbation.original_text:
8.2 Essential Patents

The Transferred Patents listed on Exhibit A comprise the Patents, both U.S. and foreign, owned or claimed by SONY or any SONY Affiliate, that are essential to the conduct of the Business as conducted by SONY.
perturbation.changed_text:
8.2 Essential Patents

The Transferred Patents listed on Exhibit A comprise the data, both U.S. and foreign, owned or claimed by SONY or any SONY Affiliate, that are essential to the conduct of the Business as conducted by SONY.
perturbation.explanation: By defining the transferred patents as comprising the data, the meaning clashes with patent law. This creates ambiguity in whether the transferred patents refer to the actual legal protections or just the data related to those patents.
perturbation.contradicted_law: United States Patent Law, which defines patents as legal rights, not simply data or information.

perturbation.original_text:
8.12 Transferability

All Transferred Patents will be fully transferable, alienable or licensable by PURCHASER from and after the Closing without restriction and without payment of any kind to any third party other than requirements under applicable laws to file documents with and pay fees to patent offices. There are no Liens on any of the Transferred Patents. (For the avoidance of doubt, the Parties acknowledge that SONY's licensees under Portfolio Cross Licenses already hold licenses to the Transferred Patents and do not need a license from PURCHASER to practice the Transferred Patents.)
perturbation.changed_text:
8.12 Transferability

All Transferred Patents may not be fully transferable, alienable or licensable by PURCHASER from and after the Closing if there is restriction and with payment of any kind to any third party other than requirements under applicable laws to file documents with and pay fees to patent offices. There are no Liens on any of the Transferred Patents. (For the avoidance of doubt, the Parties acknowledge that SONY's licensees under Portfolio Cross Licenses already hold licenses to the Transferred Patents and do not need a license from PURCHASER to practice the Transferred Patents.)
perturbation.explanation: By adding restrictions to the transferability of the Transferred Patents, the language contradicts the implied warranty of clear title and creates uncertainty regarding what conditions might impede the purchaser's ability to exploit the patents.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Implied warranty of title and the right to transfer associated with patent ownership under US patent law.
